revised_title: Observations on the Unique Features of Poisonous Snakes
tldr: The author examines the unique orifices found in certain poisonous snakes, situated between the nostril and the eye. They discovered that these orifices do not lead to the nostril or ear but to a distinct bag. These bags are lined with a cuticle, which forms the transparent cornea, and are found in venomous snakes. The purpose of the fluid secreted in these bags remains unknown.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Herpetology
